summary: Internal Deutsche Bank emails from October-November 2013 regarding an AML/KYC alert related to Jeffrey Epstein's 'Butterfly Trust'. Bank employees discuss clearing the alert for a beneficiary of the trust who was accused as a co-conspirator in a case but never tried or convicted, emphasizing she will have no account authority.

persons.name: Amanda Kirby
persons.role: Associate, Deutsche Bank Trust Company Americas
persons.context: Deutsche Bank employee corresponding with compliance about clearing an AML/KYC alert related to Jeffrey Epstein's Butterfly Trust and a beneficiary.

persons.name: Andrew Kisz
persons.role: Associate, AML Compliance Officer, DB Services New Jersey, Inc.
persons.context: AML compliance officer at Deutsche Bank who is asked for updates and provides input on the alert related to the Epstein relationship.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the grantor of the Butterfly Trust, which is the subject of the bank's internal compliance alert.

persons.name: Michael Vila
persons.context: CC'd on the initial forwarding of the RDC alert email.

persons.name: Paul Morris
persons.context: CC'd on the November 5, 2013, email asking for an update on the alert.

persons.name: Andrea Klingenberg
persons.context: CC'd on the October 8, 2013, email forwarding the RDC alert.

persons.name: Ahsan Manzoor
persons.context: Sent the initial RDC alert email on October 7, 2013, requesting compliance clearance.

connections.description: Kirby is a bank associate handling compliance matters for Epstein's financial relationship, specifically the Butterfly Trust.
Colleagues at Deutsche Bank corresponding about AML/KYC compliance alerts, with Kirby seeking updates and clearance from Kisz.
Epstein is the grantor of the Butterfly Trust, which names an unnamed individual as a beneficiary.

events.title: RDC Alert Generated
events.description: An alert is generated by Ahsan Manzoor for a party associated with Jeffrey Epstein's Butterfly Trust, requiring compliance clearance.

events.title: Bank Discussion of Alert
events.description: Amanda Kirby forwards the alert, explaining it pertains to a beneficiary of Epstein's trust who was accused as a co-conspirator but never tried/convicted, and will have no account authority.

events.title: Compliance Inquiry and Clarification
events.description: Andrew Kisz asks if the alert is part of the Epstein relationship. Amanda Kirby confirms it is, relating to the Butterfly Trust beneficiary.

events.title: Follow-up on Alert Clearance
events.description: Amanda Kirby follows up, noting the alert has been pending for nearly a month and asks for an update or if more information is needed.

keyFacts: The document reveals internal Deutsche Bank compliance discussions in 2013 regarding Jeffrey Epstein's 'Butterfly Trust' and an unnamed beneficiary.
The beneficiary was described as having been 'accused as a co-conspirator in a case but was never brought to trial nor ever convicted.'
Bank staff emphasized the beneficiary would have no personal account, no authority over the trust account, and would not be a client of the bank, seeking to clear the AML/KYC alert.
The email chain shows the alert process took nearly a month, with follow-ups from business staff to compliance.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL - PURSUANT TO FED. R. CRIM. P. 6(e)', indicating it was part of grand jury proceedings.
